title: Did BLACKPINK and BTS make K-pop popular internationally? - Quora

response.answer_text: In America, PSY really got it started with BIGBANG and SuJu. But! When BTS and Blackpink came around to America it really popped off. It just went crazy. Now internationally in general, I believe it was Rain, BoA, and TVXQ (?). I’m not sure if it was Rain or TVXQ so I’m putting both. If I’m not mistaken, BoA was one of the first idols to do the whole Japan thing. And as I’m sure you know, she’s a literal queen who walks on air upside down. If you’re questioning my mentioning of BIGBANG and SuJu, both groups were selling out shows in New York and other places in North America. SuJu was one of the first Kpop groups to sell out shows in America. A lot of people (Americans mostly) my age and up really love that group, I grew up with their music the same way I did American artists. BTS and Blackpink definitely have a big play in current international popularity though. There’s no denying it. They’re all talented youngsters.
